null.verse 18:57: 有人以主的蹟象教誨他們，但他們鄙棄它，並且忘記他們以前所犯的罪惡；有誰比他們還不義呢？我確已將薄膜加在他們的心上，以免他們了解經義，並且在他們的耳裡造重聽。如果你召他們於正道，那末，他們將永不遵循正道。
null.verse 18:58: 你的主確是至赦的，確是至慈的。假若他為他們所犯的罪惡而懲治他們，那末，他必為他們而促進刑罰的來臨，但他們有個定期，他們對那個定期，絕不能獲得一個避難所。
null.verse 18:59: 那些市鎮的居民多行不義的時候，我毀滅他們，我為他們的毀滅而預定一個期限。
null.verse 18:60: 當時，穆薩對他的僮僕說：「我將不停步，直到我到達兩海相交處，或繼續旅行若干年。」
null.verse 18:61: 當他倆到達兩海相交接處的時候，忘記了他倆的魚，那尾魚便入海悠然而去。
null.verse 18:62: 當他倆走過去的時候，他對他的僮僕說：「拿早飯來吃！我們確實疲倦了。」
null.verse 18:63: 他說：「你告訴我吧，當我們到達那座磐石下休息的時候，（我究竟是怎樣的呢？）我確已忘記了那尾魚——只因惡魔我才忘記了告訴你，——那尾魚已入海而去，那真是怪事！」
null.verse 18:64: 他說：「這正是我們所尋求的。」他倆就依來時的足蹟轉身回去。
null.verse 18:65: 他倆發現我的一個僕人，我已把從我這裡發出的恩惠賞賜他，我已把從我這裡發出的知識傳授他。
null.verse 18:66: 穆薩對他說：「我要追隨你，希望你把你所學得的正道傳授我。好嗎？」
null.verse 18:67: 他說：「你不能耐心地和我在一起。
null.verse 18:68: 你沒有徹底認識的事情你怎麼能忍受呢？」
null.verse 18:69: 穆薩說：「如果真主意欲，你將發現我是堅忍的，不會違抗你的任何命令。」
null.verse 18:70: 他說：「如果你追隨我，那末，（遇事）不要問我甚麼道理，等我自己講給你聽。」
null.verse 18:71: 他倆就同行，到了乘船的時候，他把船鑿了一個洞，穆薩說：「你把船鑿了一個洞，要想使船裡的人淹死嗎？你確已做了一件悖謬的事！」
null.verse 18:72: 他說：「我沒有對你說過嗎？你不能耐心和我在一起。」
null.verse 18:73: 穆薩說：「剛才我忘了你的囑咐，請你不要責備我，不要以我所大難的事責備我！」
null.verse 18:74: 他倆又同行，後來遇見了一個兒童，他就把那個兒童殺了，穆薩說：「你怎麼枉殺無辜的人呢？你確已做了一件凶惡的事了！」
null.verse 18:75: 他說：「難道我沒有對你說過嗎？你不能耐心地和我在一起。」
null.verse 18:76: 穆薩說：「此後，如果我再問你甚麼道理，你就可以不許我再追隨你，你對於我，總算仁至義盡了。」
null.verse 18:77: 他倆又同行，來到了一個城市，就向城裡居民求食，他們不肯款待。後來他倆在城裡發現一堵牆快要倒塌了，他就把那堵牆修理好了，穆薩說：「如果你意欲，你必為這件工作而索取工錢。」
null.verse 18:78: 他說：「我和你從此作別了。你所不能忍受的那些事，我將告訴你其中的道理。
null.verse 18:79: 至於那隻船，則是在海裡工作的幾個窮人的，我要使船有缺陷，是因為他們的前面有一個國王，要強徵一切船隻。
null.verse 18:80: 至於那個兒童，則他的父母都是信道者，我們怕他以悖逆和不信強加於他的父母，
null.verse 18:81: 所以我們要他倆的主另賞賜他倆一個更純潔、更孝敬的兒子。
null.verse 18:82: 至於那堵牆，則是城中兩個孤兒的；牆下有他倆的財寶。他倆的父親，原是善良的。你的主要他倆成年後，取出他倆的財寶，這是屬於你的主的恩惠，我沒有隨著我的私意做這件事。這是你所不能忍受的事情的道理。」
null.verse 18:83: 他們詢問左勒蓋爾奈英的故事，你說：我將對你們敘述有關他的一個報告。
null.verse 18:84: 我確已使他在大地上得勢，我賞賜他處理萬事的途徑。
null.verse 18:85: 他就遵循一條途徑，
null.verse 18:86: 直到他到達了日落之處，他覺得太陽是落在黑泥淵中，他在那黑泥淵旁發現一種人。我說：「左勒蓋爾奈英啊！你或懲治他們，或善待他們。」
null.verse 18:87: 他說：「至於不義者，我將懲罰他，然後他的主宰將把他召去，加以嚴厲懲處。
null.verse 18:88: 至於信道而且行善者，將享受最優厚的報酬，我將命令他做簡易的事情。」
null.verse 18:89: 隨後他又遵循一條路，
null.verse 18:90: 一直走到日出之處，他發現太陽正曬著一種人，我沒有給他們防日曬的工具。
null.verse 18:91: 事實就像說的那樣。我已徹知他擁有的一切。
null.verse 18:92: 隨後，他又遵循一條路，
null.verse 18:93: 一直到他到達了兩山之間的時候，他發現前面有一種人，幾乎不懂（他的）話。
null.verse 18:94: 他們說：「左勒蓋爾奈英啊！雅朱者和馬朱者，的確在地方搗亂，我們向你進貢，務請你在我們和他們之間建築一座壁壘，好嗎？」
null.verse 18:95: 他說：「我的主使我能夠享受的，尤為優美。你們以人力扶助我，我就在你們和他們之間建築一座壁壘。
null.verse 18:96: 你們拿鐵塊來給我吧。」到了他堆滿兩山之間的時候，他說：「你們拉風箱吧。」到了他使鐵塊紅如火焰的時候，他說：「你們拿溶銅來給我，我就把它傾注在壁壘上。」
null.verse 18:97: 他們就不能攀登，也不能鑿孔。
null.verse 18:98: 他說：「這是從我的主降下的恩惠，當我的主的應許降臨的時候，他將使這壁壘化為平地。我的主的應許是真實的。」
null.verse 18:99: 那日，我將使他們秩序紊亂。號角一響，我就把他們完全集合起來。
null.verse 18:100: 在那日，我要把火獄陳列在不信道者的面前。
null.verse 18:101: 他們的眼在翳子中，不能看到我的教誨，他們不能聽從。
null.verse 18:102: 難道不信道者，認為可以捨我而以我的眾僕為保護者嗎？我確已預備火獄為不信道者的招待所。
null.verse 18:103: 你說：「我告訴你們在行為方面最吃虧的人，好嗎？
null.verse 18:104: 他們就是在今世生活中徒勞無功，而認為自己是手法巧妙的人。」
null.verse 18:105: 這等人不信他們的主的蹟象，也不信將與他相會，所以他們在今世生活中的善功變為無效的，復活日我不為他們樹立權衡。
null.verse 18:106: 他們的報酬是火獄，因為他們不信道，並且把我的蹟象和使者當做笑柄。
null.verse 18:107: 信道而且行善者，得以樂園為招待所，
null.verse 18:108: 並永居其中，不願遷出。
null.verse 18:109: 你說：「假若以海水為墨汁，用來記載我的主的言辭，那末，海水必定用盡，而我的主的言辭尚未窮盡，即使我們以同量的海水補充之。」
null.verse 18:110: 你說：「我只是一個同你們一樣的凡人，我奉的啟示是：你們所應當崇拜的，只是一個主宰，故誰希望與他的主相會，就叫誰力行善功，叫誰不要以任何物與他的主受同樣的崇拜。」 你說：「假若以海水為墨汁，用來記載我的主的言辭，那末，海水必定用盡，而我的主的言辭尚未窮盡，即使我們以同量的海水補充之。」

null.verse 18:1: Sláva Bohu, jenž seslal služebníku Svému Knihu a neučinil ji křivolakou,
null.verse 18:2: nýbrž přímou, aby varovala před mocnou přísností od Něho přicházející a aby oznámila věřícím, kteří zbožné skutky konali, že obdařeni budou odměnou překrásnou,
null.verse 18:3: zahradou to, v níž navěky zůstanou,
null.verse 18:4: a aby varovala ty, kdo říkají, že Bůh pro Sebe si vzal děti.
null.verse 18:5: A nemají o tom oni ani otcové jejich žádného vědění; jak hrozné je slovo, jež z jejich úst vychází, a nic jiného než lež oni nemluví.
null.verse 18:6: Chceš se snad zahubit smutkem jda ve stopách jejich, jestliže tomuto příběhu neuvěří?
null.verse 18:7: To, co na zemi jest, učinili jsme okrasou její, abychom vyzkoušeli, kdo z nich v konání svém je nejlepší.
null.verse 18:8: A věru uděláme ze všeho toho, co na ní je, výšinu rostlinstva zbavenou!
null.verse 18:9: Domníváš se, že lidé jeskyně a ar-Raqímu byli zázrakem jedním z Našich znamení?
null.verse 18:11: A zakryli jsme uši jejich v jeskyni té během roků mnohých,
null.verse 18:12: potom jsme je vzkřísili, abychom poznali, která z obou stran lépe odhadne délku pobytu jejich.
null.verse 18:13: My vyprávíme ti příběh jejich pravdivě; vždyť mladíci to byli, kteří v Pána svého uvěřili, a jejich vedení po cestě správné jsme upevnili.
null.verse 18:14: A srdce jejich jsme posílili, když vstali a řekli: "Náš Pán je Pánem nebes a země a nikdy nebudeme vzývat božstvo jiné kromě Něho, jinak bychom lež nehoráznou hovořili.
null.verse 18:15: Tento náš lid si vzal místo Něho božstva různá, aniž o nich přinesl jasné zmocnění! A kdo je nespravedlivější než ten, kdo proti Bohu lži si vymýšlí?"
null.verse 18:16: A až se oddělíte od lidí těch a od toho, co uctívají vedle Boha, uchylte se do jeskyně! Pán váš nad vámi část milosrdenství Svého rozprostře a ve věci vaší vám ulehčení připraví.
null.verse 18:17: A byl bys viděl, jak slunce se při svém východu sklání napravo od jeskyně jejich a při svém západu je míjí nalevo, zatímco oni byli v středu jejím.
null.verse 18:18: A byl bys je pokládal za bdící, zatímco oni spali a My je napravo i nalevo kolébali; a pes jejich s předními tlapami roztaženými na prahu ležel.
null.verse 18:19: A tak jsme je vzkřísili, aby se jeden druhého vyptávali.
null.verse 18:20: Kdyby nás odkryli, ukamenovali by nás anebo by nás donutili vrátit se k náboženství svému; a pak již nikdy bychom nebyli blaženi.
null.verse 18:21: A tak jsme je odhalili (lidem z města), aby poznali, že slib Boží je pravdivý a že o Hodině pochyby žádné není.
null.verse 18:22: A budou říkat někteří: "Byli tři a čtvrtý z nich byl pes jejich.
null.verse 18:23: a neříkej o ničem: "Já zítra učiním to a to,"
null.verse 18:24: aniž připojíš: "Bude-li chtít Bůh.
null.verse 18:25: A setrvali oni v jeskyni své tři sta let a přidáno je k tomu ještě devět.
null.verse 18:26: Rci: "Bůh zná nejlépe, jak dlouho tam zůstali, a Jemu náleží nepoznatelné na nebesích a na zemi a On nejlépe je vidoucí a slyšící! A nemají oni kromě Něho ochránce žádného a On nečiní nikoho společníkem rozhodnutí Svého!"
null.verse 18:27: Sděluj tedy to, co ti bylo vnuknuto z Knihy Pána tvého; a není nikoho, kdo mohl by změnit slovo Jeho, a nenalezneš kromě Něho útočiště žádného.
null.verse 18:28: Buď neochvějný v duši své spolu s těmi, kdož Pána svého zrána i navečer vzývají po Jeho tváři toužíce! A neodvracej oči své od nich v žádosti po krásách života pozemského a neposlouchej toho, jehož srdce jsme učinili lhostejným k připomenutí Svému, ani toho, jenž jen vášně své následuje a jehož chování míru překračuje!
null.verse 18:29: A rci: "Pravda přichází od Pána vašeho; kdo chce, ať věří, a kdo chce, ať nevěří!" A věru jsme připravili pro nespravedlivé oheň, jenž hustým dýmem je obklopí.
null.verse 18:30: Ti však, kdož uvěřili a zbožné skutky konali, budou odměněni, a nedopustíme, aby se ztratila odměna těch, kdož dobré činili.
null.verse 18:31: Jim budou patřit zahrady Edenu, pod nimiž řeky tekou; tam budou se náramky zlatými zdobit, do šatů zelených z hedvábí a brokátu se odívat a v nich na lehátkách odpočívat.
null.verse 18:32: Uveď jim podobenství o dvou mužích, z nichž jednomu jsme dvě zahrady révy vinné dali, obklopené palmami, a mezi nimi jsme obilí zaseli;
null.verse 18:33: a obě zahrady plody své přinesly a pána svého v ničem nezklamaly a mezi oběma jsme řece téci dali.
null.verse 18:34: A měl ovoce a řekl druhu svému při rozhovoru: "Mám více majetku než ty a mocnější jsem i rodem svým.
null.verse 18:35: Pak do zahrady své vstoupil a sám sobě ukřivdil říkaje: "Že někdy toto zanikne, si nemyslím,
null.verse 18:36: a nedomnívám se, že kdy dostaví se Hodina; a věru i kdybych navrácen byl k Pánu svému, něco lepšího než toto naleznu tam výměnou.
null.verse 18:37: I pravil mu druh jeho v rozhovoru: "Chceš být nevděčný vůči tomu, jenž stvořil tě z prachu, pak z kapky semene a nakonec tě obdařil lidskou podobou?
null.verse 18:38: Však já hovořím: On je Bůh, Pán můj, a já k Pánu svému nepřidružuji nikoho.
null.verse 18:39: Kéž bys byl, když do zahrady své jsi vstoupil, pronesl: Nechť stane se, co Bůh chce, a není moci kromě u Boha! A vidíš-li mne majetkem a dětmi chudšího,
null.verse 18:40: možná, že mne Bůh obdaří lepším, než tvá je zahrada.
null.verse 18:41: či voda její v hlubinách země zmizí a tobě se nezdaří nalézt novou.
null.verse 18:42: A stalo se tak a plody jeho byly zničeny a jal se majitel lomit rukama nad tím, co vynaložil na ni a že od základů je zpustošena nyní, a volal: "Kéž bych byl nikoho k Pánu svému nepřidružoval!"
null.verse 18:43: A neměl čeleď žádnou, jež by mu pomohla kromě Boha, a nedočkal se pomoci.
null.verse 18:44: A tady přísluší ochrana jen Bohu skutečnému; a On nejlepší je v odměňování a k nejlepšímu vede konci.
null.verse 18:45: A uveď jim podobenství o životě pozemském: podobá se vodě, již sesíláme z nebe a s níž se mísí rostlinstvo země a pak stane se suchou travinou, již větry rozvanou.
null.verse 18:46: Majetek a synové jsou života pozemského ozdobou, však zbožné skutky, jež trvalé hodnoty jsou, u Pána tvého lepší odměnu i naději míti budou
null.verse 18:47: v den, kdy horám dáme kráčet a kdy uvidíš zemi jak rovinu srovnanou; a tehdy shromáždíme duše všechny, aniž opomineme z nich jedinou.
null.verse 18:48: A předvedeni před Pána tvého v řadách budou.
null.verse 18:49: A předložena bude Kniha každého a uvidíš provinilé v obavách z toho, co v ní je obsaženo.
null.verse 18:50: A hle, pravili jsme andělům: "Padněte na zem před Adamem!" A padli na zem všichni kromě Iblíse, jenž mezi džiny patřil a rozkazu Pána svého se zprotivil.
null.verse 18:51: Já neučinil jsem je svědky stvoření nebes a země ani jejich vlastního stvoření; a nevzal jsem si ty, kdož k bludu navádějí, za pomocníky Své.
null.verse 18:52: V den, kdy Bůh řekne:,, Zavolejte ty, jež pokládali jste za společníky Mé!", budou je vzývat, však vyslyšeni nebudou, neboť mezi nimi umístíme propast zániku;
null.verse 18:53: a provinilí spatří oheň pekelný a usoudí, že doň budou svrženi a nenaleznou z něho úniku.
null.verse 18:54: A věru jsme předložili lidem v Koránu tomto všemožné druhy příkladů, však člověk rád se o většině věcí pře.
null.verse 18:55: Nic nebrání lidem uvěřit či prosit Pána svého o odpuštění, když k nim přišlo správné vedení - leda odmítnutí připustit, že dostaví se k nim obvyklý osud dávných anebo že trest je zblízka postihne.
null.verse 18:56: A vysíláme posly Své jen jako hlasatele zvěsti radostné a jako varovatele.
null.verse 18:57: A kdo nespravedlivější je než ten, jenž při zmínce o znameních Pána svého se od nich odvrací a zapomíná na to, co ruce jeho předtím konaly? A srdce jejich jsme pokryli clonou, aby mu neporozuměli, a uši jejich jsme ucpali hluchotou.
null.verse 18:58: Pán tvůj je odpouštějící i pln milosrdenství.
null.verse 18:59: A zahubili jsme obyvatele oněch měst, když stali se nespravedlivými, a stanovili jsme pro záhubu jejich lhůtu slíbenou.
null.verse 18:60: A hle, pravil Mojžíš sluhovi svému: "Neustanu, dokud nedospěji k soutoku dvou moří, i kdybych měl věky celé jíti tomu vstříc.
null.verse 18:61: A když oba dospěli k soutoku moří dvou, zapomněli na rybu svou, jež dala se svou cestou v moře unikajíc.
null.verse 18:62: A když oba ono místo minuli, pravil Mojžíš svému sluhovi: "Přines nám oběd náš, věru nás únava z této naší cesty potkala.
null.verse 18:63: Odpověděl: "Což nevidíš, že když jsme se u skály ukrývali, zapomněl jsem na tu rybu? A jedině satan způsobil, že na ni jsem zapomněl, a nedal mi vzpomenout si na ni a ona na cestu svou v moři se zázračně vydala.
null.verse 18:64: I řekl Mojžíš: "To právě je to, co hledáme.
null.verse 18:65: A nalezli jednoho ze služebníků Našich, jehož jsme milosrdenstvím Svým obdařili a jehož jsme vědění z Nás vycházejícímu naučili,
null.verse 18:66: a Mojžíš mu řekl: "Smím tě následovat, abys mne naučil něčemu ze správného vedení, o němž jsi byl poučen?"
null.verse 18:67: Odpověděl: "Ty trpělivost se mnou mít nebudeš schopen;
null.verse 18:68: a jak bys také mohl mít trpělivost v tom, co je mimo rozsah vědění tvého?"
null.verse 18:69: Avšak Mojžíš řekl: "Bude-li Bůh chtít, shledáš mě trpělivým a já neoslyším rozkazu žádného.
null.verse 18:70: Chceš-li mne následovat, tedy se mne neptej na nic, pokud já sám tě nevybídnu svou zmínkou.
null.verse 18:71: A pokračovali dále, a když pak na lodi pluli, služebník Náš ji provrtal.
null.verse 18:72: Odvětil: "Neřekl jsem ti, že nebudeš schopen mít trpělivost se mnou?"
null.verse 18:73: I řekl Mojžíš: "Nekárej mne za to, že zapomněl jsem, a neukládej mi ve věci mé zkoušku těžkou!"
null.verse 18:74: A pokračovali dále, až potkali chlapce nějakého; i zabil jej a Mojžíš zvolal: "Zdaž zabils duši nevinnou, aniž právo pomsty jsi měl? Tys věru spáchal věc ohavnou!"
null.verse 18:75: Odpověděl: "Neřekl jsem ti, že nebudeš schopen mít trpělivost se mnou?"
null.verse 18:76: Mojžíš pravil: "Jestliže se tě po tomto ještě zeptám na cokoliv, tedy se zbav společnictví mého; a již se ti dostalo ode mne omluvy.
null.verse 18:77: A pokračovali dále, a když přišli k obyvatelům města jednoho, o jídlo je požádali, však lidé ti je pohostit odmítli.
null.verse 18:78: I odvětil: "Toto znamená rozchod mezi mnou a tebou, nicméně ti chci vysvětlení toho sdělit, v čem nebyls s to trpělivost mít.
null.verse 18:79: Co týká se lodi oné, ta patřila chudákům, kteří na moři pracují.
null.verse 18:80: A co týká se chlapce toho, rodiče jeho byli věřící, a obávali jsme se, že vzpurností a nevděkem svým on zavede je oba,
null.verse 18:81: a přáli jsme si, aby Pán jejich jim jej vyměnil za jiného, jenž bezúhonnější aby byl a lásky jejich více byl hoden.
null.verse 18:82: A co se týká té zdi, ta patřila dvěma chlapcům sirotkům ve městě tom a byl pod ní poklad pro ně předurčený; a otec jejich muž bezúhonný byl a Pán tvůj si přál, aby oni nejdříve dospělosti své dosáhli a teprve pak poklad svůj odkryli z milosrdenství Pána tvého.
null.verse 18:83: A vyptávají se tě na Dvourohého.
null.verse 18:84: Upevnili jsme moc jeho na zemi a zahrnuli jsme jej prostředky k věcem všem.
null.verse 18:85: A on za nebeským šel lanem,
null.verse 18:86: a když dospěl k slunce západu, shledal, že zapadá v prameni vroucím, a nalezl lid nějaký poblíže.
null.verse 18:87: Odpověděl: "Toho, kdo z nich je nespravedlivý, potrestám a potom bude navrácen k Pánu svému, jenž potrestá jej trestem odporným.
null.verse 18:88: A co týká se toho, kdo věří a zbožné skutky konal, tomu dostane se odměny překrásné a rozkaz, jejž dáme mu, bude snadný.
null.verse 18:89: Potom sledoval lano jiné,
null.verse 18:90: a když dospěl k slunce východu, shledal, že vychází nad lidem, jemuž jsme nedali na ochranu proti němu clony žádné.
null.verse 18:91: A tak tomu bylo a My jsme již obsáhli ve vědění Svém vše, co u něho bylo.
null.verse 18:92: Po té sledoval další lano,
null.verse 18:93: až k místu mezi dvěma hrázemi dospěl a pod nimi lid, jenž sotva chápal řeč mluvenou, našel.
null.verse 18:94: I řekli mu: "Dvourohý, věru Gog a Magog šíří spoušť po zemi; máme ti poplatek zaplatit, abys mezi námi a jimi hráz vystavěl?"
null.verse 18:95: Odpověděl: "To, co mi propůjčil Pán můj, je lepší než poplatek.
null.verse 18:96: Přineste mi kusy železa!" A když je narovnal mezi dvě úbočí, rozkázal: "Foukejte!" Když z toho vznikl oheň, dodal: "Přineste mi k vylití do něho mosaz roztavenou!"
null.verse 18:97: A nebyli Gog a Magog schopni ji přelézt ani otvor udělat v ní.
null.verse 18:98: I řekl Dvourohý: "Toto je od Pána mého milosrdenství, a až splní se slib Pána mého, na prach ji rozdrtí, vždyť Pána mého slib je vždy pravdivý.
null.verse 18:99: V ten den je ponecháme, aby jeden na druhého ve vlnách dorážel.
null.verse 18:100: V ten den pak představíme peklo nevěřícím rovnou,
null.verse 18:101: těm, jejichž oči se zavíraly před připomenutím Mým, a těm, kteří nebyli schopni slyšení.
null.verse 18:102: Domnívali se snad ti, kdož nevěřili, že si mohou brát služebníky Mé jako ochránce místo Mne?
null.verse 18:103: Rci: "Mám vás zpravit o těch, kdož největší ztrátu ve skutcích svých utrpěli,
null.verse 18:104: o těch, jichž úsilí v životě pozemském zbloudilo, ač se domnívají, že dobré činili?
null.verse 18:105: To jsou ti, kdož neuvěřili v Pána svého znamení a v setkání s Ním.
null.verse 18:106: Toto odměnou bude jejich: peklo za to, že neuvěřili a že se posmívali znamením i poslům Mým.
null.verse 18:107: Však věru ti, kdož uvěřili a zbožné skutky konali, ti budou mít zahrady rajské obydlím,
null.verse 18:108: v nich věčně přebývat budou a po změně žádné toužit nebudou.
null.verse 18:109: Rci: "Kdyby bylo moře inkoustem ke psaní slov Pána mého, bylo by moře vyčerpáno dříve, než by se spotřebovala slova Pána mého, i kdybychom inkoustem učinili ještě jedno podobné jemu.
null.verse 18:110: Rci: "Já pouze smrtelník jsem jako vy a bylo mi vnuknuto, že božstvem vaším je Bůh jediný.

null.verse 18:1: Alle lof behoort aan God, Die het Boek aan Zijn dienaar heeft geopenbaard, gaaf en volmaakt.
null.verse 18:2: Volmaakt (in leiding), om te waarschuwen voor Zijn gestrenge kastijding en de gelovigen die goede werken verrichten de blijde tijding te brengen dat zij een uitstekende beloning zullen ontvangen,
null.verse 18:3: Die zij zullen smaken in eeuwigheid.
null.verse 18:4: En om diegenen te waarschuwen, die zeggen: "God heeft Zich een zoon genomen.
null.verse 18:5: Zij hebben er geen kennis van en hun vaderen evenmin.
null.verse 18:6: Misschien zult je uit droefheid over hen sterven, omdat zij niet in deze Boodschap geloven.
null.verse 18:7: Voorwaar, Wij hebben al hetgeen op aarde is tot haar sieraad gemaakt om te beproeven, wie van hen van goede werken is.
null.verse 18:8: En zie! al hetgeen daarop is, zullen Wij tot dode stof veranderen.
null.verse 18:9: Denk je dat de lieden van de Spelonk en van de Inscriptie geen wonder onder Onze tekenen waren?
null.verse 18:10: Toen de jongelingen hun toevlucht zochten in de Spelonk, zeiden zij: "Onze Heer, verleen ons Uw genade en bereid ons een weg naar vrede en voorspoed uit onze beproeving.
null.verse 18:11: Derhalve zonderden Wij hen in de Spelonk af voor een aantal jaren.
null.verse 18:12: Daarna wekten Wij hen op, om te beproeven welke der twee partijen wijzer was, naar de tijd dat zij daar hadden vertoefd.
null.verse 18:13: Wij zullen u hun geschiedenis in waarheid verhalen.
null.verse 18:14: En Wij versterkten hun hart toen zij opstonden en zeiden: "Onze Heer is de Heer der hemelen en der aarde.
null.verse 18:15: "Dit ons volk heeft goden genomen naast Hem.
null.verse 18:16: "Wanneer jij je van hen en van hetgeen zij nevens God aanbidden verwijdert, neemt dan uw toevlucht tot de Spelonk en uw Heer zal Zijn barmhartigheid jegens u vermeerderen en uw aangelegenheden gunstig doen verlopen.
null.verse 18:17: En wanneer de zon opgaat zul je haar zich zien verwijderen rechts van de Spelonk en wanneer zij ondergaat, zie je haar zich naar links afwenden, daartussen in de holte van (de Spelonk) bevonden zij zich.
null.verse 18:18: Je denkt dat zij wakker zijn, terwijl zij slapen en Wij zullen hen zich naar links en rechts doen wenden, terwijl hun hond met zijn voorpoten uitgestrekt op de drempel ligt.
null.verse 18:19: En Wij deden hen ontwaken, zodat zij elkander konden ondervragen.
null.verse 18:20: "Want indien zij over jullie te weten komen, zullen zij jullie stenigen, of trachten jullie te bekeren tot hun godsdienst en jullie zullen nimmer kunnen slagen.
null.verse 18:21: Dit hebben wij hun bekend gemaakt, opdat zij zouden weten, dat de belofte van God waarheid is en dat er omtrent het Uur geen twijfel bestaat.
null.verse 18:22: Sommigen zullen zeggen: "Er waren er drie en de vierde was hun hond.
null.verse 18:23: En zeg niet over iets: "Ik zal het morgen doen,"
null.verse 18:24: Zonder (er bij te zeggen): "Indien het God behaagt.
null.verse 18:25: En zij bleven driehonderd jaar in hun Spelonk en voegden er negen aan toe.
null.verse 18:26: Zeg: "God weet het best, hoelang zij daar vertoefden.
null.verse 18:27: En verkondig hetgeen u door Uw Heer is geopenbaard in het Boek.
null.verse 18:28: Blijf bij degenen die hun Heer ’s morgens en ’s avonds aanroepen en die Zijn welbehagen zoeken en laat uw ogen niet van hen afdwalen door het zoeken van de praal dezer wereld en gehoorzaam niet aan hem, wiens hart Wij achteloos hebben gemaakt voor de gedachte aan Ons, noch degene die zijn begeerte volgt en wiens geval het ergste is.
null.verse 18:29: Zeg: "Het is de waarheid van uw Heer: laat daarom geloven die geloven wil en niet geloven, die niet wil.
null.verse 18:30: Wat betreft degenen die geloven en goede werken doen, voorwaar, wij doen de beloning der goeden niet verloren gaan.
null.verse 18:31: Voor dezulken zijn de Tuinen der eeuwigheid, waardoor beken vloeien.
null.verse 18:32: En geef hun de gelijkenis der twee mannen.
null.verse 18:33: Elk der tuinen bracht vruchten voort en bleef niet in gebreke.
null.verse 18:34: En hij had overvloed,en zeide tijdens een gesprek tot zijn gezel: "Ik ben rijker dan gij, aan bezit en in getal.
null.verse 18:35: En hij ging zijn tuin binnen, terwijl hij onrechtvaardig was tegenover zichzelf.
null.verse 18:36: "Noch denk ik dat het Uur zal komen.
null.verse 18:37: Zijn gezel redetwistte en zeide: "Gelooft je niet in Hem, Die u schiep uit stof, daarna uit een levenskiem en u dan vormde tot een volledig mens?"
null.verse 18:38: "Wat mij betreft, het is God Die mijn Heer is, ik zal niemand met mijn Heer vereenzelvigen.
null.verse 18:39: "Waarom zei je niet, toen je de tuin binnen ging: ’Het is zoals het God behaagt, er is geen God dan God?’ indien je mij als uw mindere in rijkdom en nakomelingen ziet,"
null.verse 18:40: "Waarschijnlijk zal mijn Heer mij iets beters geven dan uw tuin en bliksemstralen uit de hemel doen neerdalen op de uwe, waardoor deze grond kaal wordt.
null.verse 18:41: "Of het water er van in de grond doen zinken, waardoor je niet in staat zult zijn, het te bereiken.
null.verse 18:42: En zijn fruit werd vernietigd en hij begon zijn handen te wringen wegens hetgeen hij aan de tuin had besteed, terwijl het latwerk eveneens was neergestort en hij zeide: "Had ik maar niemand met mijn Heer vereenzelvigd.
null.verse 18:43: En hij had geen leger om hem tegen God te helpen, noch kon hij zich verdedigen.
null.verse 18:44: De bescherming komt alleen van God, de Ware.
null.verse 18:45: Geef hun de gelijkenis van het leven dezer wereld: het is als Wij water uit de hemel neerzenden, waardoor de planten der aarde volop groeien en daarna verdrogen zij en breken in stukken die de wind verspreidt.
null.verse 18:46: Rijkdom en kinderen zijn een sieraad van het leven dezer wereld, maar blijvende goede werken, zijn beter bij uw Heer tot beloning en hoop.
null.verse 18:47: En (gedenk) de dag waarop Wij de bergen zullen verzetten en je de aarde zult zien oprijzen en Wij hen (de mensen) zullen verzamelen en niemand hunner zullen Wij achterlaten.
null.verse 18:48: En zij zullen in rijen tot uw Heer worden gebracht.
null.verse 18:49: En het Boek zal worden voorgelegd; dan zul je de schuldigen zien vrezen wegens hetgeen daarin staat en zij zullen zeggen: "Wee ons! Wat voor een boek is dit! Het slaat klein noch groot over, doch het somt alles op.
null.verse 18:50: (Gedenk de tijd) toen Wij tot de engelen zeiden: "Buigt voor Adam", zij bogen, doch Iblies niet.
null.verse 18:51: Ik riep hen niet om te getuigen van de schepping der hemelen en der aarde, noch van hun eigen schepping noch neem Ik degenen die misleiden ooit tot helpers.
null.verse 18:52: (Gedenk) de dag waarop Hij zal zeggen: "Roept degenen waarvan je beweerde dat zij Mijn deelgenoten waren.
null.verse 18:53: En de schuldigen zullen het Vuur zien en weten dat zij daarin zullen vallen; zij zullen daar niet aan ontkomen!
null.verse 18:54: Voorwaar, Wij hebben in deze Koran voor de mensen allerlei gelijkenissen vermeld, doch de mens is in vele dingen zeer twistziek.
null.verse 18:55: En niets belet de mensen te geloven wanneer de leiding tot hen komt en hun Heer vergiffenis te vragen, dan (dat zij vragen) dat de weg der voorvaderen over hen kome of dat de straf voor hun ogen kome.
null.verse 18:56: Wij zenden de boodschappers slechts als dragers van de blijde tijding en als waarschuwers.
null.verse 18:57: En wie is onrechtvaardiger dan hij die herinnerd wordt aan de tekenen van zijn Heer, doch zich er van afwendt en vergeet, hetgeen zijn handen hebben verricht? Voorwaars Wij hebben sluiers over hun hart gelegd zodat zij niet begrijpen en doofheid in hun oren.
null.verse 18:58: Doch uw Heer is Vergevensgezind, Barmhartig.
null.verse 18:59: En deze steden! Wij vernietigden ze toen zij ongerechtigheden bedreven.
null.verse 18:60: En (gedenk de tijd) toen Mozes zeide tot zijn dienaar: "Ik zal het niet opgeven voordat ik de samenvloeiing van twee zeeën heb bereikt, al moet ik eeuwenlang voortgaan;"
null.verse 18:61: En toen zij de plek bereikten waar de beide (zeeën) samenkwamen, vergaten zij hun vis en deze zwom snel weg in de zee.
null.verse 18:62: En toen zij verder gingen, zeide hij tot zijn dienaar: "Breng ons het ochtendmaal.
null.verse 18:63: Hij antwoordde: "Zie, toen wij ons op de rots begaven vergat ik de vis - en slechts Satan deed mij vergeten er over te spreken - en de vis vond op bewonderenswaardige wijze zijn weg naar de zee.
null.verse 18:64: Hij zeide: "Dat is waarnaar wij hebben gezocht.
null.verse 18:65: Daar vonden zij een Onzer dienaren, aan wie Wij Onze barmhartigheid hadden bewezen en wie Wij van Onze kennis hadden geschonken.
null.verse 18:66: Mozes zeide tot hem: "Mag ik u volgen dat gij mij onderwijst in de leiding, die u is gegeven?"
null.verse 18:67: Hij antwoordde: "Gij kunt geen geduld hebben met mij.
null.verse 18:68: "Want hoe kun je geduldig zijn over dingen die uw begrip te boven gaan?"
null.verse 18:69: Hij zei: "Indien het Gode behaagt, zul je mij geduldig vinden en ik zal aan uw bevel niet ongehoorzaam zijn.
null.verse 18:70: Hij zei: "Welaan dan, indien je mij wenst te volgen stel mij nergens vragen over eer ik zelf daaromtrent tot u spreek.
null.verse 18:71: Aldus vertrokken beiden totdat zij in een boot stapten en hij maakte er een gat in.
null.verse 18:72: Hij antwoordde: "Had ik u niet gezegd dat je stellig geen geduld met mij zoudt kunnen tonen?"
null.verse 18:73: Mozes zeide: "Maak mij geen verwijt omdat ik het vergeten ben en maak het mij niet moeilijk.
null.verse 18:74: Zij reisden dus verder tot dat zij een knaap ontmoetten en hij deze doodsloeg.
null.verse 18:75: Hij antwoordde: "Zei ik u niet dat je nimmer in staat zoudt zijn mij met geduld te vergezellen?"
null.verse 18:76: Mozes zeide: "Indien ik u wederom iets vraag houd mij dan niet in uw gezelschap, dan hebt gij zeker een verontschuldiging van mijn kant.
null.verse 18:77: Aldus vervolgden zij hun weg totdat zij bij de inwoners ener stad kwamen aan wie zij om eten vroegen, doch dezen weigerden hun gastvrijheid te betonen.
null.verse 18:78: Hij zeide: "Dit is de scheiding tussen u en mij.
null.verse 18:79: "Wat de boot betreft, deze behoorde aan arme lieden die op de rivier werkten, en ik verkoos haar onbruikbaar te maken want achter hen was een koning die alle (goede) schepen met geweld in beslag wilde nemen.
null.verse 18:80: "En wat de jongeling betreft, zijn ouders waren gelovigen en wij vreesden dat hij schande over hen zou brengen door zijn opstandigheid en ongeloof.
null.verse 18:81: "Derhalve wensten wij dat hun Heer hun in zijn plaats een ander kind zou schenken dat reiner en zachtmoediger zou zijn (dan hij).
null.verse 18:82: "En wat de muur betreft, deze behoorde aan twee weesjongens in de stad en daaronder lag hun schat (begraven), hun vader was een rechtvaardig man derhalve behaagde het uw Heer dat zij volwassen zouden worden en dan hun schat zouden opgraven als een genade van uw Heer, en dit alles deed ik niet uit mezelf.
null.verse 18:83: Men vraagt u betreffende Zol-Qarnain.
null.verse 18:84: Wij vestigden zijn macht op aarde en schonken hem de middelen (en het vermogen) alles te volbrengen.
null.verse 18:85: En hij volgde een weg,
null.verse 18:86: totdat hij het verste punt in de richting van de ondergaande zon bereikte, en deze in een bron van modderig water zag ondergaan, waarbij hij een (ongelovig) volk aantrof.
null.verse 18:87: Hij zeide: "Wat betreft degene die kwaad doet, hem zullen wij straffen; daarna zal hij worden teruggebracht tot zijn Heer die hem straffen zal met een gestrengere straf.
null.verse 18:88: "Doch wat hem betreft die gelooft en oprecht handelt, hij zal een goede beloning ontvangen, en Wij zullen hem op Ons bevel alle gemakken verschaffen.
null.verse 18:89: Vervolgens ging hij een andere weg.
null.verse 18:90: Totdat hij het land van de rijzende zon bereikte, en ontdekte dat zij over een volk opging voor hetwelk Wij geen beschutting er tegen hadden verschaft.
null.verse 18:91: Zo was het, en Wij hadden volledig kennis van wat hij bezat.
null.verse 18:92: Vervolgens ging hij weer een andere weg.
null.verse 18:93: Totdat hij tussen twee bergen kwam, waar hij een volk aantrof dat amper een woord verstond.
null.verse 18:94: Zij zeiden: "O Zol-Qarnain, Gog en Magog stichten onheil op aarde, mogen wij u dan schatting betalen mits je een afscheiding tussen hen en ons opricht?"
null.verse 18:95: Hij antwoordde: "De macht waarmee mijn Heer mij heeft bekleed is beter, doch je kunt mij met lichamelijke kracht helpen.
null.verse 18:96: "Brengt mij blokken ijzer.
null.verse 18:97: Derhalve waren zij (Gog en Magog) niet (meer) in staat er overheen te klimmen, noch waren zij bij machte er doorheen te graven.
null.verse 18:98: Hij zeide: "Dit is een genade van mijn Heer.
null.verse 18:99: En op die Dag zullen Wij sommigen hunner tegen anderen laten opstaan en de bazuin zal worden geblazen.
null.verse 18:100: En Wij zullen op die dag de hel aan de ongelovigen tonen.
null.verse 18:101: Wier ogen gesluierd waren voor de herinnering aan Mij, en die zelfs niet konden horen.
null.verse 18:102: Denken de ongelovigen dat zij Mijn dienaren tot beschermers kunnen nemen buiten Mij? Voorwaar Wij hebben de hel bereid tot een onthaal voor de ongelovigen.
null.verse 18:103: Zeg: "Zullen wij u verhalen omtrent degenen die het grootste verlies in hun werken zullen lijden?"
null.verse 18:104: Diegenen, wier streven gericht is op het leven dezer wereld en denken dat zij een bijzonder goed werk verrichten,
null.verse 18:105: Dezen zijn het die de tekenen van hun Heer en de ontmoeting met Hem verwerpen.
null.verse 18:106: De hel is hun beloning wegens hun ongeloof en de spot die zij met Mijn Tekenen en Mijn boodschappers bedreven.
null.verse 18:107: Voorwaar, de gelovigen die goede werken doen, zullen de tuinen van het Paradijs tot onthaal hebben.
null.verse 18:108: Daarin zullen zij vertoeven en zij zullen niet wensen daaruit weg te gaan.
null.verse 18:109: Zeg: "Al ware de oceaan inkt voor de Woorden van mijn Heer, zo zou de oceaan zijn uitgeput eer de Woorden van mijn Heer ten einde komen - zelfs al zouden Wij er evenveel ter aanvulling toevoegen.
null.verse 18:110: Zeg: "Ik ben slechts een mens gelijk gij, doch mij wordt geopenbaard dat uw God slechts één God is.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:1: Praise be to Allah Who hath revealed the Scripture unto His slave, and hath not placed therein any crookedness,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:2: (But hath made it) straight, to give warning of stern punishment from Him, and to bring unto the believers who do good works the news that theirs will be a fair reward,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:3: Wherein they will abide for ever;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:4: And to warn those who say: Allah hath chosen a son,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:5: (A thing) whereof they have no knowledge, nor (had) their fathers, Dreadful is the word that cometh out of their mouths.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:6: Yet it may be, if they believe not in this statement, that thou (Muhammad) wilt torment thy soul with grief over their footsteps.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:7: Lo! We have placed all that is on the earth as an ornament thereof that We may try them: which of them is best in conduct.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:8: And lo! We shall make all that is thereon a barren mound.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:9: Or deemest thou that the People of the Cave and the Inscription are a wonder among Our portents ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:10: When the young men fled for refuge to the Cave and said: Our Lord! Give us mercy from Thy presence, and shape for us right conduct in our plight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:11: Then We sealed up their hearing in the Cave for a number of years.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:12: And afterward We raised them up that We might know which of the two parties would best calculate the time that they had tarried.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:13: We narrate unto thee their story with truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:14: And We made firm their hearts when they stood forth and said: Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:15: These, our people, have chosen (other) gods beside Him though they bring no clear warrant (vouchsafed) to them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:16: And when ye withdraw from them and that which they worship except Allah, then seek refuge in the Cave; your Lord will spread for you of His mercy and will prepare for you a pillow in your plight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:17: And thou mightest have seen the sun when it rose move away from their cave to the right, and when it set go past them on the left, and they were in the cleft thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:18: And thou wouldst have deemed them waking though they were asleep, and We caused them to turn over to the right and the left, and their dog stretching out his paws on the threshold.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:19: And in like manner We awakened them that they might question one another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:20: For they, if they should come to know of you, will stone you or turn you back to their religion; then ye will never prosper.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:21: And in like manner We disclosed them (to the people of the city) that they might know that the promise of Allah is true, and that, as for the Hour, there is no doubt concerning it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:22: (Some) will say: They were three, their dog the fourth, and (some) say: Five, their dog the sixth, guessing at random; and (some) say: Seven, and their dog the eighth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:23: And say not of anything: Lo! I shall do that tomorrow,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:25: And (it is said) they tarried in their Cave three hundred years and add nine.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:26: Say: Allah is Best Aware how long they tarried.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:27: And recite that which hath been revealed unto thee of the Scripture of thy Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:28: Restrain thyself along with those who cry unto their Lord at morn and evening, seeking His Countenance; and let not thine eyes overlook them, desiring the pomp of the life of the world; and obey not him whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who followeth his own lust and whose case hath been abandoned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:29: Say: (It is) the truth from the Lord of you (all).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:30: Lo! as for those who believe and do good works - Lo! We suffer not the reward of one whose work is goodly to be lost.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:31: As for such, theirs will be Gardens of Eden, wherein rivers flow beneath them; therein they will be given armlets of gold and will wear green robes of finest silk and gold embroidery, reclining upon throne therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:32: Coin for them a similitude: Two men, unto one of whom We had assigned two gardens of grapes, and We had surrounded both with date-palms and had put between them tillage.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:33: Each of the gardens gave its fruit and withheld naught thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:35: And he went into his garden, while he (thus) wronged himself.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:36: I think not that the Hour will ever come, and if indeed I am brought back unto my Lord I surely shall find better than this as a resort.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:37: His comrade, when he (thus) spake with him, exclaimed: Disbelievest thou in Him Who created thee of dust, then of a drop (of seed), and then fashioned thee a man ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:38: But He is Allah, my Lord, and I ascribe unto my Lord no partner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:39: If only, when thou enteredst thy garden, thou hadst said: That which Allah willeth (will come to pass)! There is no strength save in Allah! Though thou seest me as less than thee in wealth and children,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:40: Yet it may be that my Lord will give me better than thy garden, and will send on it a bolt from heaven, and some morning it will be a smooth hillside,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:41: Or some morning the water thereof will be lost in the earth so that thou canst not make search for it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:42: And his fruit was beset (with destruction).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:43: And he had no troop of men to help him as against Allah, nor could he save himself.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:44: In this case is protection only from Allah, the True, He is Best for reward, and best for consequence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:45: And coin for them the similitude of the life of the world as water which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingleth with it and then becometh dry twigs that the winds scatter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:46: Wealth and children are an ornament of the life of the world.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:47: And (bethink you of) the Day when we remove the hills and ye see the earth emerging, and We gather them together so as to leave not one of them behind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:48: And they are set before thy Lord in ranks (and it is said unto them): Now verily have ye come unto Us as We created you at the first.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:49: And the Book is placed, and thou seest the guilty fearful of that which is therein, and they say: What kind of a Book is this that leaveth not a small thing nor a great thing but hath counted it! And they find all that they did confronting them, and thy Lord wrongeth no-one.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:50: And (remember) when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, and they fell prostrate, all save Iblis.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:51: I made them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation; nor choose I misleaders for (My) helpers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:52: And (be mindful of) the Day when He will say: Call those partners of Mine whom ye pretended.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:53: And the guilty behold the Fire and know that they are about to fall therein, and they find no way of escape thence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:54: And verily We have displayed for mankind in this Qur’an all manner of similitudes, but man is more than anything contentious.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:55: And naught hindereth mankind from believing when the guidance cometh unto them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord unless (it be that they wish) that the judgment of the men of old should come upon them or (that) they should be confronted with the Doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:56: We send not the messengers save as bearers of good news and warners.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:57: And who doth greater wrong than he who hath been reminded of the revelations of his Lord, yet turneth away from them and forgetteth what his hands send forward (to the Judgment) ? Lo! on their hearts We have placed coverings so that they understand not, and in their ears a deafness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:58: Thy Lord is the Forgiver, Full of Mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:59: And (all) those townships! We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:60: And when Moses said unto his servant: I will not give up until I reach the point where the two rivers meet, though I march on for ages.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:61: And when they reached the point where the two met, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the waters, being free.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:62: And when they had gone further, he said unto his servant: Bring us our breakfast.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:63: He said: Didst thou see, when we took refuge on the rock, and I forgot the fish - and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention it - it took its way into the waters by a marvel.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:64: He said: This is that which we have been seeking.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:65: Then found they one of Our slaves, unto whom We had given mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our presence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:66: Moses said unto him: May I follow thee, to the end that thou mayst teach me right conduct of that which thou hast been taught ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:67: He said: Lo! thou canst not bear with me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:68: How canst thou bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any knowledge ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:69: He said: Allah willing, thou shalt find me patient and I shall not in aught gainsay thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:70: He said: Well, if thou go with me, ask me not concerning aught till I myself make mention of it unto thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:71: So they twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a hole therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:72: He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:73: (Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my fault.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:74: So they twain journeyed on till, when they met a lad, he slew him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:75: He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:76: (Moses) said: If I ask thee after this concerning aught, keep not company with me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:77: So they twain journeyed on till, when they came unto the folk of a certain township, they asked its folk for food, but they refused to make them guests.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:78: He said: This is the parting between thee and me! I will announce unto thee the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear with patience.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:79: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the river, and I wished to mar it, for there was a king behind them who is taking every ship by force.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:80: And as for the lad, his parents were believers and we feared lest he should oppress them by rebellion and disbelief.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:81: And we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in purity and nearer to mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:82: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father had been righteous, and thy Lord intended that they should come to their full strength and should bring forth their treasure as a mercy from their Lord; and I did it not upon my own command.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:83: They will ask thee of Dhu’l-Qarneyn.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:84: Lo! We made him strong in the land and gave him unto every thing a road.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:86: Till, when he reached the setting-place of the sun, he found it setting in a muddy spring, and found a people thereabout.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:87: He said: As for him who doeth wrong, we shall punish him, and then he will be brought back unto his Lord, Who will punish him with awful punishment!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:88: But as for him who believeth and doeth right, good will be his reward, and We shall speak unto him a mild command.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:90: Till, when he reached the rising-place of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had appointed no shelter therefrom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:93: Till, when he came between the two mountains, he found upon their hither side a folk that scarce could understand a saying.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:94: They said: O Dhu’l-Qarneyn! Lo! Gog and Magog are spoiling the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:95: He said: That wherein my Lord hath established me is better (than your tribute).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:96: Give me pieces of iron - till, when he had levelled up (the gap) between the cliffs, he said: Blow! - till, when he had made it a fire, he said: Bring me molten copper to pour thereon.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:97: And (Gog and Magog) were not able to surmount, nor could they pierce (it).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:98: He said: This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord cometh to pass, He will lay it low, for the promise of my Lord is true.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:99: And on that day we shall let some of them surge against others, and the Trumpet will be blown.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:100: On that day we shall present hell to the disbelievers, plain to view,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:101: Those whose eyes were hoodwinked from My reminder, and who could not bear to hear.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:102: Do the disbelievers reckon that they can choose My bondmen as protecting friends beside Me ? Lo! We have prepared hell as a welcome for the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:103: Say: Shall We inform you who will be the greatest losers by their works ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:104: Those whose effort goeth astray in the life of the world, and yet they reckon that they do good work.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:105: Those are they who disbelieve in the revelations of their Lord and in the meeting with Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:106: That is their reward: hell, because they disbelieved, and made a jest of Our revelations and Our messengers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:107: Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs are the Gardens of Paradise for welcome,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:108: Wherein they will abide, with no desire to be removed from thence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:109: Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily the sea would be used up before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even though We brought the like thereof to help.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 18:110: Say: I am only a mortal like you.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:1: Praise be to God, Who hath sent to His Servant the Book, and hath allowed therein no Crookedness:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:2: (He hath made it) Straight (and Clear) in order that He may warn (the godless) of a terrible Punishment from Him, and that He may give Glad Tidings to the Believers who work righteous deeds, that they shall have a goodly Reward,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:3: Wherein they shall remain for ever:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:4: Further, that He may warn those (also) who say, "God hath begotten a son":
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:5: No knowledge have they of such a thing, nor had their fathers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:6: Thou wouldst only, perchance, fret thyself to death, following after them, in grief, if they believe not in this Message.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:7: That which is on earth we have made but as a glittering show for the earth, in order that We may test them - as to which of them are best in conduct.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:8: Verily what is on earth we shall make but as dust and dry soil (without growth or herbage).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:9: Or dost thou reflect that the Companions of the Cave and of the Inscription were wonders among Our Sign?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:10: Behold, the youths betook themselves to the Cave: they said, "Our Lord! bestow on us Mercy from Thyself, and dispose of our affair for us in the right way!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:11: Then We draw (a veil) over their ears, for a number of years, in the Cave, (so that they heard not):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:12: Then We roused them, in order to test which of the two parties was best at calculating the term of years they had tarried!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:13: We relate to thee their story in truth: they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We advanced them in guidance:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:14: We gave strength to their hearts: Behold, they stood up and said: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth: never shall we call upon any god other than Him: if we did, we should indeed have uttered an enormity!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:15: "These our people have taken for worship gods other than Him: why do they not bring forward an authority clear (and convincing) for what they do? Who doth more wrong than such as invent a falsehood against God?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:16: "When ye turn away from them and the things they worship other than God, betake yourselves to the Cave: Your Lord will shower His mercies on you and disposes of your affair towards comfort and ease.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:17: Thou wouldst have seen the sun, when it rose, declining to the right from their Cave, and when it set, turning away from them to the left, while they lay in the open space in the midst of the Cave.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:18: Thou wouldst have deemed them awake, whilst they were asleep, and We turned them on their right and on their left sides: their dog stretching forth his two fore-legs on the threshold: if thou hadst come up on to them, thou wouldst have certainly turned back from them in flight, and wouldst certainly have been filled with terror of them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:19: Such (being their state), we raised them up (from sleep), that they might question each other.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:20: "For if they should come upon you, they would stone you or force you to return to their cult, and in that case ye would never attain prosperity.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:21: Thus did We make their case known to the people, that they might know that the promise of God is true, and that there can be no doubt about the Hour of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:22: (Some) say they were three, the dog being the fourth among them; (others) say they were five, the dog being the sixth,- doubtfully guessing at the unknown; (yet others) say they were seven, the dog being the eighth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:23: Nor say of anything, "I shall be sure to do so and so tomorrow"-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:24: Without adding, "So please God!" and call thy Lord to mind when thou forgettest, and say, "I hope that my Lord will guide me ever closer (even) than this to the right road.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:25: So they stayed in their Cave three hundred years, and (some) add nine (more)
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:26: Say: "God knows best how long they stayed: with Him is (the knowledge of) the secrets of the heavens and the earth: how clearly He sees, how finely He hears (everything)! They have no protector other than Him; nor does He share His Command with any person whatsoever.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:27: And recite (and teach) what has been revealed to thee of the Book of thy Lord: none can change His Words, and none wilt thou find as a refuge other than Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:28: And keep thy soul content with those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His Face; and let not thine eyes pass beyond them, seeking the pomp and glitter of this Life; no obey any whose heart We have permitted to neglect the remembrance of Us, one who follows his own desires, whose case has gone beyond all bounds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:29: Say, "The truth is from your Lord": Let him who will believe, and let him who will, reject (it): for the wrong-doers We have prepared a Fire whose (smoke and flames), like the walls and roof of a tent, will hem them in: if they implore relief they will be granted water like melted brass, that will scald their faces, how dreadful the drink! How uncomfortable a couch to recline on!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:30: As to those who believe and work righteousness, verily We shall not suffer to perish the reward of any who do a (single) righteous deed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:31: For them will be Gardens of Eternity; beneath them rivers will flow; they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and they will wear green garments of fine silk and heavy brocade: They will recline therein on raised thrones.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:32: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:33: Each of those gardens brought forth its produce, and failed not in the least therein: in the midst of them We caused a river to flow.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:34: (Abundant) was the produce this man had : he said to his companion, in the course of a mutual argument: "more wealth have I than you, and more honour and power in (my following of) men.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:35: He went into his garden in a state (of mind) unjust to his soul: He said, "I deem not that this will ever perish,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:36: "Nor do I deem that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) come: Even if I am brought back to my Lord, I shall surely find (there) something better in exchange.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:37: His companion said to him, in the course of the argument with him: "Dost thou deny Him Who created thee out of dust, then out of a sperm-drop, then fashioned thee into a man?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:38: "But (I think) for my part that He is God, My Lord, and none shall I associate with my Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:39: "Why didst thou not, as thou wentest into thy garden, say: ’God’s will (be done)! There is no power but with God!’ If thou dost see me less than thee in wealth and sons,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:40: "It may be that my Lord will give me something better than thy garden, and that He will send on thy garden thunderbolts (by way of reckoning) from heaven, making it (but) slippery sand!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:41: "Or the water of the garden will run off underground so that thou wilt never be able to find it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:42: So his fruits (and enjoyment) were encompassed (with ruin), and he remained twisting and turning his hands over what he had spent on his property, which had (now) tumbled to pieces to its very foundations, and he could only say, "Woe is me! Would I had never ascribed partners to my Lord and Cherisher!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:43: Nor had he numbers to help him against God, nor was he able to deliver himself.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:44: There, the (only) protection comes from God, the True One.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:45: Set forth to them the similitude of the life of this world: It is like the rain which we send down from the skies: the earth’s vegetation absorbs it, but soon it becomes dry stubble, which the winds do scatter: it is (only) God who prevails over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:46: Wealth and sons are allurements of the life of this world: But the things that endure, good deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best as (the foundation for) hopes.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:47: One Day We shall remove the mountains, and thou wilt see the earth as a level stretch, and We shall gather them, all together, nor shall We leave out any one of them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:48: And they will be marshalled before thy Lord in ranks, (with the announcement), "Now have ye come to Us (bare) as We created you first: aye, ye thought We shall not fulfil the appointment made to you to meet (Us)!":
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:49: And the Book (of Deeds) will be placed (before you); and thou wilt see the sinful in great terror because of what is (recorded) therein; they will say, "Ah! woe to us! what a Book is this! It leaves out nothing small or great, but takes account thereof!" They will find all that they did, placed before them: And not one will thy Lord treat with injustice.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:50: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:51: I called them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor (even) their own creation: nor is it for helpers such as Me to take as lead (men) astray!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:52: One Day He will say, "Call on those whom ye thought to be My partners," and they will call on them, but they will not listen to them; and We shall make for them a place of common perdition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:53: And the Sinful shall see the fire and apprehend that they have to fall therein: no means will they find to turn away therefrom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:54: We have explained in detail in this Qur’an, for the benefit of mankind, every kind of similitude: but man is, in most things, contentious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:55: And what is there to keep back men from believing, now that Guidance has come to them, nor from praying for forgiveness from their Lord, but that (they ask that) the ways of the ancients be repeated with them, or the Wrath be brought to them face to face?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:56: We only send the apostles to give Glad Tidings and to give warnings: But the unbelievers dispute with vain argument, in order therewith to weaken the truth, and they treat My Signs as a jest, as also the fact that they are warned!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:57: And who doth more wrong than one who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord, but turns away from them, forgetting the (deeds) which his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set veils over their hearts lest they should understand this, and over their ears, deafness, if thou callest them to guidance, even then will they never accept guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:58: But your Lord is Most forgiving, full of Mercy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:59: Such were the populations we destroyed when they committed iniquities; but we fixed an appointed time for their destruction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:60: Behold, Moses said to his attendant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and years in travel.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:61: But when they reached the Junction, they forgot (about) their Fish, which took its course through the sea (straight) as in a tunnel.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:62: When they had passed on (some distance), Moses said to his attendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much fatigue at this (stage of) our journey.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:63: He replied: "Sawest thou (what happened) when we betook ourselves to the rock? I did indeed forget (about) the Fish: none but Satan made me forget to tell (you) about it: it took its course through the sea in a marvellous way!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:64: Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after:" So they went back on their footsteps, following (the path they had come).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:65: So they found one of Our servants, on whom We had bestowed Mercy from Ourselves and whom We had taught knowledge from Our own Presence.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:66: Moses said to him: "May I follow thee, on the footing that thou teach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been taught?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:67: (The other) said: "Verily thou wilt not be able to have patience with me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:68: "And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy understanding is not complete?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:69: Moses said: "Thou wilt find me, if God so will, (truly) patient: nor shall I disobey thee in aught.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:70: The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me, ask me no questions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:71: So they both proceeded: until, when they were in the boat, he scuttled it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:72: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:73: Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting, nor grieve me by raising difficulties in my case.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:74: Then they proceeded: until, when they met a young man, he slew him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:75: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:76: (Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this, keep me not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full) excuse from my side.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:77: Then they proceeded: until, when they came to the inhabitants of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused them hospitality.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:78: He answered: "This is the parting between me and thee: now will I tell thee the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:79: "As for the boat, it belonged to certain men in dire want: they plied on the water: I but wished to render it unserviceable, for there was after them a certain king who seized on every boat by force.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:80: "As for the youth, his parents were people of Faith, and we feared that he would grieve them by obstinate rebellion and ingratitude (to God and man).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:81: "So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange (a son) better in purity (of conduct) and closer in affection.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:82: "As for the wall, it belonged to two youths, orphans, in the Town; there was, beneath it, a buried treasure, to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: So thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure - a mercy (and favour) from thy Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:84: Verily We established his power on earth, and We gave him the ways and the means to all ends.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:86: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it set in a spring of murky water: Near it he found a People: We said: "O Zul-qarnain! (thou hast authority,) either to punish them, or to treat them with kindness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:87: He said: "Whoever doth wrong, him shall we punish; then shall he be sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a punishment unheard-of (before).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:88: "But whoever believes, and works righteousness,- he shall have a goodly reward, and easy will be his task as We order it by our Command.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:90: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no covering protection against the sun.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:91: (He left them) as they were: We completely understood what was before him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:93: Until, when he reached (a tract) between two mountains, he found, beneath them, a people who scarcely understood a word.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:94: They said: "O Zul-qarnain! the Gog and Magog (People) do great mischief on earth: shall we then render thee tribute in order that thou mightest erect a barrier between us and them?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:95: He said: "(The power) in which my Lord has established me is better (than tribute): Help me therefore with strength (and labour): I will erect a strong barrier between you and them:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:97: Thus were they made powerless to scale it or to dig through it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:98: He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it into dust; and the promise of my Lord is true.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:99: On that day We shall leave them to surge like waves on one another: the trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them all together.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:100: And We shall present Hell that day for Unbelievers to see, all spread out,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:101: (Unbelievers) whose eyes had been under a veil from remembrance of Me, and who had been unable even to hear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:102: Do the Unbelievers think that they can take My servants as protectors besides Me? Verily We have prepared Hell for the Unbelievers for (their) entertainment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:103: Say: "Shall we tell you of those who lose most in respect of their deeds?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:104: "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life, while they thought that they were acquiring good by their works?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:105: They are those who deny the Signs of their Lord and the fact of their having to meet Him (in the Hereafter): vain will be their works, nor shall We, on the Day of Judgment, give them any weight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:106: That is their reward, Hell, because they rejected Faith, and took My Signs and My Messengers by way of jest.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:107: As to those who believe and work righteous deeds, they have, for their entertainment, the Gardens of Paradise,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:108: Wherein they shall dwell (for aye): no change will they wish for from them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:109: Say: "If the ocean were ink (wherewith to write out) the words of my Lord, sooner would the ocean be exhausted than would the words of my Lord, even if we added another ocean like it, for its aid.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 18:110: Say: "I am but a man like yourselves, (but) the inspiration has come to me, that your God is one God: whoever expects to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and, in the worship of his Lord, admit no one as partner.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:1: Praise belongs to God who has sent down upon His servant the Book and has not assigned unto it any crookedness;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:2: right, to warn of great violence from Him, and to give good tidings unto the believers, who do righteous deeds, that theirs shall be a goodly wage
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:4: and to warn those who say, ’God has taken to Himself a son’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:5: they have no knowledge of it, they nor their fathers; a monstrous word it is, issuing out of their mouths; they say nothing but a lie.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:6: Yet perchance, if they believe not in this tiding, thou wilt consume thyself, following after them, of grief.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:7: We have appointed all that is on the earth for an adornment for it, and that We may try which of them is fairest in works;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:8: and We shall surely make all that is on it barren dust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:9: Or dost thou think the Men of the Cave and Er-Rakeem were among Our signs a wonder?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:10: When the youths took refuge in the Cave saying, ’Our lord, give us mercy from Thee, and furnish us with rectitude in our affair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:11: Then We smote their ears many years in the Cave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:13: We will relate to thee their tidings truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:14: And We strengthened their hearts, when they stood up and said, ’Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and earth; we will not call upon any god, apart from Him, or then we had spoken outrage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:15: These our people have taken to them other gods, apart from Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:16: So, when you have gone apart from them and that they serve, excepting God, take refuge in the Cave, and your Lord will unfold to you of His mercy, and will furnish -- you with a gentle issue of your affair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:17: And thou mightest have seen the sun, when it rose, inclining from their Cave towards the right, and, when it set, passing them by on the left, while they were in a broad fissure of the Cave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:18: Thou wouldst have thought them awake, as they lay sleeping, while We turned them now to the right, now to the left,’ and their dog ’stretching its paws on the threshold.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:19: And even so We raised them up again that they might question one another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:20: If they should get knowledge of you they will stone you, or restore you to their creed, then you will not prosper ever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:21: And even so We made them stumble upon them, that they might know that God’s promise is true, and that the Hour -- there is no doubt of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:22: (They will say, ’Three; and ’their dog was the fourth of them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:23: And do not say, regarding anything, ’I am going to do that tomorrow,’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:24: but only, ’If God will’; and mention thy Lord, when thou forgettest, and say, ’It may be that my Lord will guide me unto something nearer to rectitude than this.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:25: And they tarried in the Cave three hundred years, and to that they added nine more.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:26: Say: ’God knows very well how long they tarried.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:27: Recite what has been revealed to thee of the Book of thy Lord; no man can change His words.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:28: And restrain thyself with those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening, desiring His countenance, and let not thine eyes turn away from them, desiring the adornment of the present life; and obey not him whose heart We have made neglectful of Our remembrance so that he follows his own lust, and his affair has become all excess.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:29: Say: ’The truth is from your Lord; so let whosoever will believe, and let whosoever will disbelieve.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:30: Surely those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- surely We leave not to waste the wage of him who does good works;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:31: those -- theirs shall be Gardens of Eden, underneath which rivers flow; therein they shall be adorned with bracelets of gold, and they shall be robed in green garments of silk and brocade, therein reclining upon couches -- O, how excellent a reward! And O, how fair a resting-place!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:32: And strike for them a similitude: two men.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:33: each of the two gardens yielded its produce and failed naught in any wise; and We caused to gush amidst them a river.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:34: So he had fruit; and he said to his fellow, as he was conversing with him, ’I have more abundance of wealth than thou and am mightier in respect of men.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:35: And he entered his garden, wronging himself; he said, ’I do not think that this will ever perish;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:36: I do not think that the Hour is coming; and if I am indeed returned to my Lord, I shall surely find a better resort than this.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:37: Said his fellow, as he was conversing with him, ’What, disbelievest thou in Him who created thee of dust, then of a sperm-drop, then shaped thee as a man?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:38: But lo, He is God, my Lord, and I will not associate with my Lord any one.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:39: Why, when thou wentest into thy garden, didst thou not say, "As God will; there is no power except in God"? If thou seest me, that I am less than thou in wealth and children,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:40: yet it may be that my Lord will give me better than thy garden, and loose on it a thunderbolt out of heaven, so that in the morning it will be a slope of dust,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:41: or in the morning the water of it will be sunk into the earth, so that thou wilt not be able to seek it out.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:42: And his fruit was all encompassed, and in the morning he was wringing his hands for that he had expended upon it, and it was fallen down upon its trellises, and he was saying, ’Would I had not associated with my Lord any one!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:43: But there was no host to help him, apart from God, and he was helpless.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:44: Thereover protection belongs only to God the True; He is best rewarding, best in the issue.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:45: And strike for them the similitude of the present life: it is as water that We send down out of heaven, and the plants of the earth mingle with it; and in the morning it is straw the winds scatter; and God is omnipotent over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:46: Wealth and sons are the adornment of the present world; but the abiding things, the deeds of righteousness, are better with God in reward, and better in hope.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:47: And on the day We shall set the mountains in motion, and thou seest the earth coming forth, and We muster them so that We leave not so much as one of them behind;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:48: and they shall be presented before their Lord in ranks -- ’You have come to Us, as We created you upon the first time; nay, you asserted We should not appoint for you a tryst.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:49: And the Book shall be set in place; and thou wilt see the sinners fearful at what is in it, and saying, ’Alas for us! How is it with this Book, that it leaves nothing behind, small or great, but it has numbered it?’ And they shall find all they wrought present, and thy Lord shall not wrong anyone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:50: And when We said to the angels, ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he was one of the jinn, and committed ungodliness against his Lord’s command.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:51: I made them not witnesses of the creation of the heavens and earth, neither of the creation of themselves; I would not ever take those who lead others astray to be My supporters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:52: And on the day He shall say, ’Call on My associates whom you asserted’; and then they shall call on them, but they will not answer them, and We shall set a gulf between them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:53: Then the evildoers will see the Fire, and think that they are about to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:54: We have indeed turned about for men in this Koran every manner of similitude; man is the most disputatious of things.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:55: And naught prevented men from believing when the guidance came unto them, and seeking their Lord’s forgiveness, but that the wont of the ancients should come upon them, or that the chastisement should come upon them face to face.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:56: And We send not the Envoys, but good tidings to bear, and warning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:57: And who does greater evil than he who, being reminded of the signs of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets what his hands have forwarded? Surely We have laid veils on their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears heaviness; and though thou callest them to the guidance, yet they will not be guided ever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:58: But thy Lord is the All-forgiving, full of mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:59: And those cities, We destroyed them when they did evil, and appointed for their destruction a tryst.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:60: And when Moses said to his page, ’I will not give up until I reach the meeting of the two seas, though I go on for many years.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:61: Then, when they reached their meeting, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, burrowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:62: When they had passed over, he said to his page, ’Bring us our breakfast; indeed, we have encountered weariness from this our journey.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:63: He said, ’What thinkest thou? When we took refuge in the rock, then I forgot the fish-and it was Satan himself that made me forget it so that I should not remember it -- and so it took its way into the sea in a manner marvellous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:64: Said he, ’This is what we were seeking!’ And so they returned upon their tracks, retracing them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:65: Then they found one of Our servants unto whom We had given mercy from Us, and We had taught him knowledge proceeding from Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:66: Moses said to him, ’Shall I follow thee so that thou teachest me, of what thou hast been taught, right judgment.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:67: Said he, ’Assuredly thou wilt not be able to bear with me patiently.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:68: And how shouldst thou bear patiently that thou hast never encompassed in thy knowledge?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:69: He said, ’Yet thou shalt find me, if God will, patient; and I shall not rebel against thee in anything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:70: Said he, ’Then if thou followest me, question me not on anything until I myself introduce the mention of it to thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:71: So they departed; until, when they embarked upon the ship, he made a hole in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:72: Said he, ’Did I not say that thou couldst never bear with me patiently?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:73: He said, ’Do not take me to task that I forgot, neither constrain me to do a thing too difficult.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:74: So they departed; until, when they met a lad, he slew him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:75: Said he, ’Did I not say that thou couldst never bear with me patiently?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:76: He said, ’If I question thee on anything after this, then keep me company no more; thou hast already experienced excuse sufficient on my part.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:77: So they departed; until, when they reached the people of a city, they asked the people for food, but they refused to receive them hospitably.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:78: Said he, ’This is the parting between me and thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:79: As for the ship, it belonged to certain poor men, who toiled upon the sea; and I desired to damage it, for behind them there was a king who was seizing every ship by brutal force.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:80: As for the lad, his parents were believers; and we were afraid he would impose on them insolence and unbelief;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:81: so we desired that their Lord should give to them in exchange one better than he in purity, and nearer in tenderness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:82: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan lads in the city, and under it was a treasure belonging to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:83: They will question thee concerning Dhool Karnain.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:84: We established him in the land, and We gave him a way to everything;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:86: until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a muddy spring, and he found nearby a people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:87: He said, ’As for the evildoer, him we shall chastise, then he shall be returned to his Lord and He shall chastise him with a horrible chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 18:88: But as for him who believes, and does righteousness, he shall receive as recompense the reward most fair, and we shall speak to him, of our command, easiness.
